paper.title: The impact of COVID-19 on the degree of dependence and structure of risk-return relationship: A quantile regression approach
paper.abstract: This paper examines the impact of the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) on the degree and structure of risk-return dependence in the US. The results from quantile regression (QR) indicate a left-tailed asymmetric dependence structure of sectoral returns with market portfolio. Following the COVID-19 outbreak, degree of dependence among returns and market portfolio have increased in the higher quantiles. Further, the outbreak has converted left-tailed dependence into a righttailed dependence. Interaction among Google Search Index for coronavirus (GSIC) and returns also examined. Findings reveal an asymmetric GSIC-return dependence that is significant in tails.

domain_result.justification: 该论文研究了COVID-19对风险-收益依赖关系的影响，并使用了分位数回归方法分析部门收益与市场投资组合之间的依赖结构。这些内容直接涉及金融风险管理中对风险-收益关系的评估，以及投资组合管理中部门收益与市场投资组合的关联分析。
